alert.note: Alert for Blue Earth; Brown; Nicollet; Watonwan (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 1:02AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Brown, northwestern Blue Earth, Watonwan and Nicollet Counties through 145 AM CDT... At 102 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Lafayette to 6 miles northwest of St. James. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Lafayette around 110 AM CDT. Hanska around 120 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Madelia, Lewisville and Lake Crystal. This includes U.S. Highway 14 between mile markers 87 and 123. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
